InfoCard.Title: Simple Chart Demostration
InfoCard.Description: This is a simple demo of the chart. It reads the data from the sample DataTable created on page load. The data table has sales data of sales of fitness equipment for ABC Inc. The data is given as follows: {East, 3.4, 5.6, 9.3} {Central, 1.9, 3.4, 1.3} {West, 2.8, 3.3, 4.3}

InfoCard.Title: Data bound chart demostration
InfoCard.Description: This sample shows how to create a simple databound charting application

InfoCard.Title: Coloring and related properties
InfoCard.Description: This sample demonstrates how to set color, transparency, and other color related properties for the different chart layers.

InfoCard.Title: Various Chart Types
InfoCard.Description: This is an application which will let you view each of the different chart types.

InfoCard.Title: Changing Properties at runtime.
InfoCard.Description: This sample allows you to change different properties on the chart at runtime. This sample is good for displaying exactly how different properties affect the appearance of the chart.

InfoCard.Title: Chart Tooltips related
InfoCard.Description: This sample demonstrates how to set tooltips for the chart. It also shows how tooltips can be formatted.

InfoCard.Title: Labeling the charts
InfoCard.Description: This sample demonstrates how to set labels for the chart. It also shows how label can be formatted.

InfoCard.Title: Binding Chart to DataTable
InfoCard.Description: This sample demonstrates how to bind a chart to a DataTable. The DataTable is created dynamically through code. This sample also show printing functionality for the chart.

InfoCard.Title: Binding chart to external Database like Northwind
InfoCard.Description: This sample binds a chart to the NorthWind database. [Note: The NorthWind database is a sample database that comes with MSSQL server, which is included in the .Net framework (.Net/SDK). In order for this sample to run properly MSSQL server should be running on the local machine and the current user should have priviledges to connect to the server.

InfoCard.Title: Demostration for 3D Charts
InfoCard.Description: This sample shows the available 3D charts and their features, including zooming and rotating.

InfoCard.Title: Demnostrating various data sources
InfoCard.Description: This sample shows how a chart can use XML data, Stream data as well as Collection data, besides using Binding Manager. Once data Binding Manager is selected in the drop down box, add, delete, or modify data in the table.

InfoCard.Title: Showing Text on the chated elements
InfoCard.Description: This sample how to show data on the elements of a chart.

InfoCard.Title: Data Range Sample
InfoCard.Description: This sample shows how to configure the chart to show data only within a certain range of values.

InfoCard.Title: Grid and Chart Integration
InfoCard.Description: This sample shows how data grid adapter can be used to show child data for data selected in the master table.

InfoCard.Title: Charting Drilldowns
InfoCard.Description: This sample shows the how Chart Drill Down works.

InfoCard.Title: Multilayer charts
InfoCard.Description: This sample shows the usage of Multiple Chart types(ColumnLine and ScatterLine).

InfoCard.Title: Multivalue tooltips
InfoCard.Description: Certain types of charts in the list show tooltips with multiple values. Choose the Chart Type from the bottom of the chart. The list on the right will show the corresponding Label used.

InfoCard.Title: Scrolling /Zooming and Paint Element Demostration
InfoCard.Description: Shows the usage of scrolling and using Paint Element.

InfoCard.Title: Custom Layers Samples
InfoCard.Description: Shows how the developer can write Layers and access chart area. Only for advanced use.

InfoCard.Title: Financial application using layers
InfoCard.Description: In this sample, the simple moving averages of fictitious company share prices are calculated when the user right-clicks on the chart area and applies one or more overlays. It demonstrates how developers can write Layers overlaying the chart with values calculated from the chart's data.
